content: Please confirm that you want to reactivate your {{productName}}.

comment.text: This translation key is used for a confirmation message that asks users to reactivate their product when logging back into an application. The message includes the product name and appears in a dialog or button context. Translators should provide a neutral tone while confirming the user's action.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'يرجى تأكيد رغبتك في إعادة تنشيط {{productName}} الخاص بك.' is a literal translation and sounds slightly awkward in Arabic. A more natural phrasing would be more conversational.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: يرجى تأكيد إعادة تفعيل {{productName}} الخاص بك.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While acceptable, the use of 'الخاص بك' feels slightly formal for this context. A more casual phrasing could improve user experience.

The translation 'Lütfən, {{productName}}-i yenidən aktivləşdirmək istədiyinizi təsdiqləyin.' is not the most natural phrasing in Azerbaijani. While technically correct, it sounds a bit formal and literal. A more conversational and natural translation would be 'Zəhmət et, {{productName}}-i yenidən aktivləşdirməyi təsdiqlə.' or 'Təsdiqlə ki, {{productName}}-i yenidən aktivləşdirmək istəyirsiniz.'
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'Zəhmət et, {{productName}}-i yenidən aktivləşdirməyi təsdiqlə.' or 'Təsdiqlə ki, {{productName}}-i yenidən aktivləşdirmək istəyirsiniz.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'prostor' (space) doesn't accurately translate 'product'. It implies a physical space, whereas 'product' refers to a service or item. A better translation would convey the meaning of a specific service or item being reactivated.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Potvrďte prosím, že chcete znovu aktivovat svůj {{productName}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The German translation is actually French. The English phrase 'Please confirm that you want to reactivate your {{productName}}' should be translated into German, not French.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Bitte bestätigen Sie, dass Sie Ihre {{productName}} wieder aktivieren möchten.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'reactivate' is best translated as 'ξαναδραστηριοποιήσετε' or 'επανενεργοποιήσετε'. 'Ενεργοποιήσετε ξανά' is a literal translation and sounds less natural in Greek.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Επιβεβαιώστε ότι θέλετε να ξαναδραστηριοποιήσετε το {{productName}} σας.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'reactivate' isn't perfectly captured by 'aktivoida uudelleen'. While 'aktivoida' means 'to activate,' adding 'uudelleen' (again) feels slightly less natural in this context in Finnish. A more natural phrasing would convey the sense of restoring a previous active state.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'Ole hyvä ja vahvista, että haluat palauttaa {{productName}}-si aktiiviseksi.' (Please confirm that you want to restore your {{productName}} to active.) or 'Ole hyvä ja vahvista, että haluat kääntää {{productName}}-si uudelleen käyttöön.' (Please confirm that you want to put your {{productName}} back into use.)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation 'ເປີດໃຊ້ຄືນໃໝ່' (perdt sai khuen mai) while generally meaning 'reactivate', can be a bit awkward. A more natural phrasing might be 'ເປີດການໃຊ້ງານຄືນ' (perdt kan chai ngan khuen) or 'ດໍາເນີນການໃຊ້ງານຄືນ' (dam noen kan chai ngan khuen).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider revising to 'ກະລຸນາຢືນຢັນວ່າທ່ານຕ້ອງການເປີດການໃຊ້ງານ {{productName}} ຂອງທ່ານຄືນໃໝ່.' or 'ກະລຸນາຢືນຢັນວ່າທ່ານຕ້ອງການດໍາເນີນການໃຊ້ງານ {{productName}} ຂອງທ່ານຄືນໃໝ່.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'spațiu' (space) is not an accurate translation of 'product' in this context. It implies a storage area rather than the product itself.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Confirmați că doriți să reactivați produsul dvs. {{productName}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'කරුණාකර' (karunakarA) is slightly formal for this context. While not incorrect, a more conversational tone might be preferred.
The exclamation mark is missing at the end of the sentence. It’s a common practice in Sinhala to end sentences with punctuation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ඔබගේ {{productName}} නැවත සක්‍රිය කිරීමට වුවමනා බව කරුණාකර තහවුරු කරන්න.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Potrdi, če želiš znova aktivirati svoj {{productName}}' is a bit awkward. 'Če želiš' translates to 'if you want', which isn't the most natural phrasing for a confirmation prompt. A more direct and natural translation would be 'Potrdite, da želite znova aktivirati svoj {{productName}}.'
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Potrdite, da želite znova aktivirati svoj {{productName}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The original English prompt uses 'Please confirm'. The Slovenian translation lacks the formality of 'Please'. While not strictly incorrect, maintaining a similar level of formality improves consistency.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Prosim, potrdite, da želite znova aktivirati svoj {{productName}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'kích hoạt lại' (reactivate) isn't the most natural phrasing in Vietnamese for this context. A more common and clearer phrasing would be 'mở lại' (re-enable/turn on again).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Xin vui lòng xác nhận rằng bạn muốn mở lại {{productName}} của mình.
